caption: Table 5 Distribution of polyps by location among 13,881 patients

Both age and sex effects were significant; an age by sex interaction was not found. ## Location More than half the patients had biopsy specimens isolated within either the right colon (n = 3,943; 28.4 %), the transverse colon (n = 3,288; 23.7 %), or a combination of the two (n = 864; 6.2 %) (Table 5) – regions beyond the reach of a sigmoidoscope. Only 29.1 % of patients had specimens isolated to the left side of the colon: left colon (n = 1,379; 9.9 %), sigmoid colon (n = 2,382; 17.2 %), rectum (n = 94; 0.7 %), or a combination of these sites (n = 180; 1.3 %).
